title.rendered: InventHelp Inventors Develop Improved Pool Chair PBT-4059

content.rendered:
PITTSBURGH, July 19, 2024 /PRNewswire/ — “We wanted to create an improved pool chair for relaxing in the water for swimmers at all ability levels,” said one of two inventors, from Phoenix, Ariz., “so we invented the POOL CHAIR. Our design ensures you remain in a stationary position at the pool’s edge.”

The invention provides a convenient new design for a pool chair. In doing so, it offers an alternative to a conventional raft or floating lounge chair for less self-confident swimmers. As a result, it prevents the user from drifting along the water’s surface. It also increases comfort. The invention features a unique design that is easy to use so it is ideal for recreational swimmers, swimming pool owners, resorts or hotels.

The original design was submitted to the Phoenix sales office of InventHelp. It is currently available for licensing or sale to manufacturers or marketers. For more information, write Dept. 22-PBT-4059, InventHelp, 100 Beecham Drive, Suite 110, Pittsburgh, PA 15205-9801, or call (412) 288-1300 ext. 1368. Learn more about InventHelp’s Invention Submission Services at http://www.InventHelp.com. 

SOURCE InventHelp

Originally published at https://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/inventhelp-inventors-develop-improved-pool-chair-pbt-4059-302200150.html
Images courtesy of https://pixabay.com
